snippet: Roger Wilson, who was governor for three months after the plane crash that killed Gov. Mel Carnahan in 2000, was sentenced to two years of probation for misusing money to make political donations.
abstract: Roger Wilson, who was governor of Missouri for three months after the plane crash that killed Gov Mel Carnahan in 2000, is sentenced to two years of probation for misusing money to make political donations to the state Democratic Party in 2009.
lead_paragraph: Roger Wilson, who was governor for three months after the plane crash that killed Gov. Mel Carnahan in 2000, was sentenced to two years of probation for misusing money to make political donations.

headline.main: Missouri: Ex-Governor Gets Probation in Campaign Fund Case
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Ex-Governor Gets Probation In Campaign Fund Case
